Yes, because it's harassment.
Alternatively you can just mute them.
If you have to ask, maybe you just shouldnt say it.

> [{quoted}](name=Kuthillick,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=zhdpTnvH,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-10-17T22:18:35.477+0000)
>
> If you have to ask, maybe you just shouldnt say it.


Why do you assume I said it? Mabye I want to report a player that was toxic and im not sure if stfu is enough.

You are mistaking the system for a word search. 

The ML system reads your whole chat to determine whether you used your chat is a insulting and harassing manner. One word alone won't make the report valid.

> [{quoted}](name=Kei143,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=zhdpTnvH,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-10-17T22:11:41.681+0000)
>
> You are mistaking the system for a word search. 
> 
> The ML system reads your whole chat to determine whether you used your chat is a insulting and harassing manner. One word alone won't make the report valid.

Well sometimes one word can make a ban. I am pretty sure if you type "kys" you get a insta ban. Just wanted to know if stfu is the same case
Kys is part of the ZT system, not ML system.
The list of "instant ban" words is limited to hate speech and things like that which are completely unacceptable in any situation in League of Legends.
The context is also important, saying "i need to stfu i'm missing cs" would be much different than "stfu u suck" for example.
No, it’s not if it’s the only word or one of the few words you said. I’ve done it before and no punishment

stfu is far from something that would end up as a sudden ban. Sure it could be seen as something reportable but I've said it before and nothing came from it. However, if you continually say it across a match, and other things that are never acceptable such as "kys" then you could end up with something worse.

Specific words are not reportable unless they are zero tolerance terms like "kys" and a few slurs.

What is reportable is overall behavior, and the system is fairly good at determining the difference between positive banter and negative flaming. In general, if you have to ask, dont.
